titleStmt.title: Benjamin Lanter et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5548

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency-
Thos E Bramlett.
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Ky-

The Undersigned Citizens of Grant Co Ky would respectfully represent that one Thos. J. Odor after tried under an Indictment found by the Grand Jury at its May Term 18.63. at the Oct Term next thereafter and was fined Fifty Dollars. founded The offence was a Trespass to personal property Now we the undersigned would respectfully state that we are acquainted with T. J. Odor & have been for many years and have known him to be a peacible quiet orderly man and is such now. That he is quite a poor man with a wife & three helpless children, all depending on his daily labor for support. We would be pleased if your Excellency would remit so much of the said fine as is consistent with your duty

J Q Gauge
T C Clark
G H Plamer
Wm Littell
W F Evans
R G Marks
Benjamin Lanter
Joseph Simpson
T J Gouge
J S Lucas
T. M. Hutchison
Henry Wallace
B. Wilson
James W. Collins
Jed Ashcroft
A Lingenfelter
I am the man that endited J T Oddor
J H R Lawrence

Grant County
Relief Refused
Tho E Bramlette63
